title: 107_s1042
content: The Act titled "Filipino Veterans' Benefits Improvements Act of 2001" establishes the rate of payment for certain benefits for new Philippine Scouts residing in the United States. The Act redesignates provisions in Section 107 of title 38, United States Code, and adjusts the rate of payment for benefits, with specific amendments outlined. The Act amends Section 107 of title 38, United States Code, by adjusting payment rates for benefits and specifying effective dates for the changes. SEC. 3 amends the rate of payment for dependency and indemnity compensation for surviving spouses of certain Filipino veterans under title 38, United States Code. The effective date for this amendment is the date of enactment of the Act. SEC. 4 addresses the eligibility of certain Filipino veterans for disability pension. The eligibility and rate of payment for dependency and indemnity compensation for surviving spouses of certain Filipino veterans under title 38, United States Code are amended. The eligibility criteria are updated in subsections (a) and (b), with changes to paragraphs and sections. The rate of payment is also adjusted in a new subsection. The eligibility and rate of payment for dependency and indemnity compensation for surviving spouses of certain Filipino veterans under title 38, United States Code are amended. Amendments include changes to subsections (a) and (b) regarding eligibility criteria and adjustments to the rate of payment in a new subsection. The amendments made by this section affect the eligibility and rate of payment for dependency and indemnity compensation for surviving spouses of certain Filipino veterans under title 38, United States Code. The changes include adjustments to the rate of payment in a new subsection, with benefits paid at a rate of $100 per month to individuals residing in the Republic of the Philippines. The effective date of these amendments is the date of enactment of this Act, applying to benefits for months beginning on or after that date. SEC. 5. ELIGIBILITY OF FILIPINO VETERANS FOR HEALTH CARE IN THE UNITED STATES. The Secretary shall provide hospital and nursing home care to Commonwealth Army veterans and new Philippine Scouts as per section 1710 of title 38, United States Code. SEC. 6. OUTPATIENT HEALTH CARE FOR VETERANS RESIDING IN THE PHILIPPINES. The Secretary shall furnish outpatient care and services to World War II veterans, Commonwealth Army veterans, and new Philippine Scouts residing in the Philippines at the Manila VA Outpatient Clinic. The expenditure for this purpose is limited to $500,000 per fiscal year. The Secretary provides outpatient care to veterans and scouts in the Philippines at the Manila VA Outpatient Clinic, with an annual expenditure limit of $500,000. Outpatient care and services for World War II veterans in the Philippines will be provided as per the amendments made by this section, effective on the enactment date of this Act.
